1.name: Ruby
1.creator: Snelling, Lauraine.
1.abstract: Ruby Torvald sets out on a daunting journey with her young sister, Opal, to hopefully see their long-lost father once more and claim the promised inheritance. But instead of the treasure they expected, the sisters discover something most shocking. -- Book Cover.
1.source: <simpledc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"><dc:creator>Snelling, Lauraine.</dc:creator><dc:date>c2003</dc:date><dc:description>Ruby Torvald sets out on a daunting journey with her young sister, Opal, to hopefully see their long-lost father once more and claim the promised inheritance. But instead of the treasure they expected, the sisters discover something most shocking. -- Book Cover.</dc:description><dc:format>320 p. ; 22 cm.</dc:format><dc:identifier>0764290762</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>9780764290763</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>0764222228</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>9780764222221</dc:identifier><dc:language>eng</dc:language><dc:publisher>Bethany House Publishers</dc:publisher><dc:relation>Dakotah treasures ; 1</dc:relation><dc:subject>Inheritance and succession--Fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Fathers and daughters--Fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Women pioneers--Fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Sisters--Fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Medora (N.D.)--Fiction.</dc:subject><dc:title>Ruby </dc:title><dc:type>Christian fiction.</dc:type><dc:type>Western stories.</dc:type><dc:type>Text</dc:type></dublinCore>

2.name: Ruby Holler
2.creator: Creech, Sharon.
2.abstract: Thirteen-year-old fraternal twins Dallas and Florida have grown up in a terrible orphanage but their lives change forever when an eccentric but sweet older couple invites them each on an adventure, beginning in an almost magical place called Ruby Holler.
2.source: <simpledc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"><dc:creator>Creech, Sharon.</dc:creator><dc:date>c2002</dc:date><dc:description>1st ed.</dc:description><dc:description>Thirteen-year-old fraternal twins Dallas and Florida have grown up in a terrible orphanage but their lives change forever when an eccentric but sweet older couple invites them each on an adventure, beginning in an almost magical place called Ruby Holler.</dc:description><dc:description>The Silver Bird -- The Boxton Creek Home -- Ruby Holler -- Mush -- Thinking Corners -- The Opportunity -- Doubts -- Hansel and Gretel -- The God -- The Egg -- The Grump -- Work -- Gravy -- Wood -- Conversations in the Night -- The Axe -- The Rocker -- The Trepids -- Understone Funds -- Through the Holler -- Lost and Found -- A Trip to Boxton -- Ready -- Tiller and Sairy -- The Holler at Night -- Shack Talk -- Trials -- Mrs. Trepid -- Decisions -- Nightmares -- Medicine -- Paddling and Hiking -- Z's Report -- Bearings -- Stiff -- A Long Chain -- Word Pictures -- Surveying -- The Worrywarts -- Babies in the Box -- Shopping -- Dorkhead -- Loops -- Progress -- The Rock -- Stones in the Holler -- Running -- More Shopping -- Underwater -- The Feeling -- Z -- The One-Log Raft -- The Dunces -- Slow Motion -- On the Road -- On the River -- The Soggy Heart -- Preparations -- Investments -- Hospital Talk -- Mr. Trepid's Adventure -- Jewels -- Mission-Accomplished Cake -- Appraisals -- Conversations in the Night -- Dreams.</dc:description><dc:format>310 p. ; 22 cm.</dc:format><dc:identifier>0060277327</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>9780060277321</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>0060277335 (lib. bdg)</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>9780060277338 (lib. bdg)</dc:identifier><dc:language>eng</dc:language><dc:publisher>Joanna Cotler Books/Harper Collins Publishers</dc:publisher><dc:relation xsi:type="http://purl.org/dc/terms/URI">http://www.loc.gov/catdir/description/hc041/00066371.html</dc:relation><dc:subject>Orphans--Juvenile fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Twins--Juvenile fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Brothers and sisters--Juvenile fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Wood-carvers--Juvenile fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Country life--Juvenile fiction.</dc:subject><dc:subject>Voyages and travels--Juvenile fiction.</dc:subject><dc:title>Ruby Holler </dc:title><dc:type>Text</dc:type><dc:date>001109</dc:date><dc:identifier>   00066371 </dc:identifier><dc:identifier>45487314</dc:identifier></dublinCore>

3.name: Through my eyes
3.creator: Bridges, Ruby.
3.abstract: Ruby Bridges recounts the story of her involvement, as a six-year-old, in the integration of her school in New Orleans in 1960.
3.source: <simpledc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"><dc:creator>Bridges, Ruby.</dc:creator><dc:date>1999</dc:date><dc:description>1st ed.</dc:description><dc:description>Ruby Bridges recounts the story of her involvement, as a six-year-old, in the integration of her school in New Orleans in 1960.</dc:description><dc:description>green dot</dc:description><dc:format>63 p. : ill. ; 28 cm.</dc:format><dc:identifier>0590189239 (hc)</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>9780590189231 (hc)</dc:identifier><dc:language>eng</dc:language><dc:publisher>Scholastic Press</dc:publisher><dc:subject>Bridges, Ruby--Juvenile literature.</dc:subject><dc:subject>African American children--Louisiana--New Orleans--Biography--Juvenile literature.</dc:subject><dc:subject>African Americans--Louisiana--New Orleans--Biography--Juvenile literature.</dc:subject><dc:subject>School integration--Louisiana--New Orleans--Juvenile literature.</dc:subject><dc:subject>New Orleans (La.)--Race relations--Juvenile literature.</dc:subject><dc:title>Through my eyes </dc:title><dc:type>Text</dc:type><dc:date>981216</dc:date><dc:identifier>   98049242 </dc:identifier><dc:identifier>40588556</dc:identifier></dublinCore>

4.name: Loving ghuardian Jack
4.creator: Andrews, V. C. (Virginia C.)
4.abstract: growing up in the heart of Cajun country, the only family Ruby Landry has ever known are her loving ghuardian Jack, a drunken outcast who lives alone in a shack in the swamp.

5.name: Tough-minded little mouse
5.creator: Emberley, Michael.
5.abstract: While taking cheese pies to her Granny, Ruby, a small but tough-minded little mouse, forgets her mother's advice not to talk to cats. Story is a variation on Red Riding Hood.
